subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Cleveland Browns linebacker Willie McGinest said the 2008 season would be his last. McGinest told SI.com that he wanted to finish his career on one last playoff run in his 15th N.F.L. season. McGinest, who played 12 seasons and won three Super Bowls with the New England Patriots, signed a three-year, $12 million contract with the Browns in 2006, reuniting him with his former defensive coordinator Romeo Crennel.
